## invert() function

Inverts the keys and values of the provided object. Values must be valid property keys (string, number, or symbol). If a value is not a valid property key, it will be skipped.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function invert<const T extends object>(source: T): Mutable<InvertObject<T>>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

source


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The object whose keys and values should be inverted


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[Mutable](./toolkit.mutable.md)<!-- -->&lt;[InvertObject](./toolkit.invertobject.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;&gt;

A new object where the original values are keys and original keys are values

## Example


```ts
invert({ a: 1, b: 2, c: 3 }) // { 1: "a", 2: "b", 3: "c" }
invert({ x: "foo", y: "bar" }) // { foo: "x", bar: "y" }
invert({ a: 1, b: null }) // { 1: "a" } // null is not a valid property key
```
